729014f-a.title: Richmond: Hylan Boulevard - Satterlee Street
729014f-a.text:
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee
Street and Wards Noint Avenue, showing the Billopp
House, or ''Conference House.'' In this house was held,
on September 11, 1776, a conference between Benjamin
Franklin, John Adams, and Edward Rutledge represent-
ing the Continental Congress and AdmiraI Mord Howe,
commanding the British haval forces. The house de-
rives its name from Christopher 8illopp, who circum-
navigated Staten Island in less than twenty-fomr hours
and claimed it for Nev York State.
About 1905
Py Eugene G. Putnrm
From 5taten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTI NS
(2)
The baement kitchen of the Billopp House.
About 1905
By Eugene G. Putnm
From Staten lIsland Nuseum Collection through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

729016f-c.title: Richmond: Hylan Boulevard - Satterlee Street
729016f-c.text:
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee Street
and Wards Point Avenue, showing the Billopp House (also called
''Conference House''). It was built in 1688 by Chtistopher Billopp
who aided Wew Yorkts claim to Staten Island by circumnavigating
the island in hfs own vessel in less than twenty-four hours.
Tn this house took place a confe ence between Howe and an American
committee, composed of Adams, Franklin and Rutledge.
About 1930
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr
NOO REPRODUCTI13

729015f-a.title: Richmond: Hylan Boulevard - Satterlee Street
729015f-a.text:
r jww
BILLCPP HCU5E Hylan Boulevard and Satterlee Street, Iottenville,
Staten Island. Built by and for Christopher Sillopp about
1680, this Dutch Colonial residence was for many years a
center of gracious New York hospitality. It is Known also
as ''Conference House' because denjamin hranklin, John Adams
and Idward Rutledge met here with the English general, Lord
Howe, on Se)tember 11, iD, in an unsuccessful effort to
halt the American Revolution.
Bank ofNew York Calendar 196768

729013f-a.text:
(1)
Hylan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee
Street and Wards Point Avenue, showing the 8illop
House, or ''Conference House.'' In this house was
held the famous conference betseen a committee repre-
senting the Continental Congress, consistiig of Ben-
jamin Franklin, John Adams, and Edward Rutledge and
Admiral Lord Howe. The house derives its name from
Christopher Billopp.
About 1905

729017f-a.title: Richmond: Hylan Boulevard - Satterlee Street
729017f-a.text:
HyAan Boulevard, north side, between Satterlee
Street and wards Point Avenue, showing two views of the
Billopp House ('Conference House'). nnere was held the
conference, on September 11, 1776, between Benjamin Franklin,
John Adams and Edward Rutledge representing the Continental
Congress and Admiral Lord Howe, coamanding the British naval
forces.
August, 1934
Views 1-2
Photos by S. Landsran
CREDIT LINE IMPEA2I9E
(3)
The rear of the Billopp House, before it was
Nrestored.
1924
P. L. Sperr
